text: The 2017–18 season is Northampton Town's 121st season of existence and their second season back in League One after a seven-year absence. Along with competing in League One, the club will also participate in the FA Cup, EFL Cup and EFL Trophy. colspan="14" style="background:#dcdcdc; text- align:center;"| Out on Loan |- |7||Billy Waters||CF||||Epsom||||23||0||Cheltenham Town||8 June 2017||Undisclosed||2020 |- |15||Dean Bowditch||AM||||Bishop's Stortford||||26||2||Milton Keynes Dons||23 June 2017||Free||2019 |- |23||Joe Iaciofano||CF||||Northampton||||4||0||Youth||4 October 2016||N/A||2019 |- |30||Luke Coddington||GK||||Middlesbrough||||2||0||Huddersfield Town||17 August 2017||N/A||2019 |} ==Competitions== ===Friendlies=== As of 26 June 2017, Northampton Town have announced six pre-season friendlies, against Derby County, Frome Town, Northampton Sileby Rangers, Kettering Town, Birmingham City 'Dev' and Newport County. ===League One=== ====League table==== ====League position by match==== ====Matches==== On 21 June 2017, the league fixtures were announced. ===FA Cup=== On 16 October 2017, the first round draw was made with Northampton Town drawn at home against Scunthorpe United. A 0–0 draw meant a replay had to be played at Glanford Park. ===EFL Cup=== On 16 June 2017, the first round draw was made with Northampton Town drawn away against QPR. ===EFL Trophy=== On 12 July 2017, the group stage draw was made with Northampton Town drawn in a group with Southampton U23s, Cambridge United and Peterborough United. After finished as runners-up in the group stages, Northampton were drawn away to Portsmouth in the second round. ===Appearances, goals and cards=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-
